column1: :Tolkien mentions that the name Fëanor is a Sindarinized version of the Quenya Fëanáro
column2: but is not proper Sindarin. His genuine Sindarin name would be Faenor instead.

column1: Wiktionary:fae is an archaic English word referring to "magic" or "fairies". This word was used by J.R.R. Tolkien in the early version of his legendarium (The Book of Lost Tales Part One) to refer to the Valar and the Elves.
